DOC.brief_title: Biobehavioral Cultural Determinants Betel Quid Chewing , Dependence , Withdrawal Taiwan
DOC.detailed_description: Cancer oral cavity one fast grow cancer among men Taiwan . Previous research establish strong link betel quid chewing , common practice among Taiwanese men , oral cancer . However , despite strong association , attempt make develop behavioral measure facilitate betel quid cessation . This application extend upon exist collaboration MD Anderson China Medical University Hospital ( CMUH ) seek characterize betel quid chewer withdrawal symptom , order address urgent cancer epidemiology issue Taiwan . In two phase study , use qualitative approach ( guided focus group interview ) , follow assessment betel quid withdrawal current chewer : 1 ) 47 participant invited participate qualitative study include focus group in-depth structured interview examine social cultural context surround continue use cessation betel quid consumption , 2 ) 30 male female healthy individual currently chew betel quid smoke cigarette invite attend 4 separate session CMUH complete self-report questionnaire specifically design measure betel quid withdrawal symptom , relationship betel quid chew cigarette smoking withdrawal . This application represent first step development multi-phase , multidisciplinary betel quid chew research program . This program enhance understanding cultural bio-behavioral aspect betel quid chew . Furthermore , lead translational research project link behavioral finding clinical treatment , eventual creation large scale , population-based prevention education program .
